ai.summary: The Lough Shannagh hike is a challenging 19.1 km loop in the UK that circles Lough Shannagh. The route blends lake-edge paths with rolling hills, delivering steady ascents, rocky sections, and a demanding day for experienced hikers.
ai.terrain_summary: Varied terrain includes grassy moorland, gravel tracks, rocky outcrops, and woodland around the lake. Expect wet and muddy sections, uneven footing, and some steep ascents and descents.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather before you go; UK conditions can change quickly on exposed hills. The route traverses remote sections with limited mobile coverage, so carry a map and compass (or a reliable GPS) and inform someone of your plan. Wear sturdy boots and dress in layers with a waterproof outer layer. Be prepared for slippery rocks near the water, variable visibility, and fatigue—carry enough water and energy snacks, and consider a spare power bank for devices.
recommended_gear: Layered clothing with a waterproof outer shell
Map and compass or GPS device
Emergency whistle and a charged mobile phone with spare power bank
Hat and gloves for cold or windy conditions
Walking poles (optional but helpful on uneven terrain)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) are the best times for this hike due to longer daylight and typically firmer ground; winter hiking is possible but more challenging and weather-dependent.

seo.title: Lough Shannagh Hike – 19.1 km Hard Trek in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the challenging 19.1 km Lough Shannagh hike in the UK. Learn about the terrain, safety tips, and gear you need for a rewarding day on the trails.
